sentence.Network_cn: 人群变得狂暴起来，并向警察投掷汽油弹。

sentence.Network_en: Sightseers may be a little overwhelmed by the crowds and noise.
sentence.Network_cn: 拥挤的人群和喧闹的噪音可能会让游客有些茫然不知所措。

entry.def: A crowd is a large group of people who have gathered together, for example to watch or listen to something interesting, or to protest about something.

example.ex: A huge crowd gathered in a square outside the Kremlin walls...
example.tran: 一大群人聚集在克里姆林宫墙外的广场上。

example.ex: It took some two hours before the crowd was fully dispersed...
example.tran: 大概花了两个小时才把人群全部疏散开。

entry.tran: (志趣相投或工作相同的)一伙人，一帮人
entry.def: A particular crowd is a group of friends, or a set of people who share the same interests or job.

example.ex: All the old crowd have come out for this occasion.
example.tran: 那些老伙计们都来参加这一庆典。

entry.def: When people crowd around someone or something, they gather closely together around them.

example.ex: The hungry refugees crowded around the tractors...
example.tran: 饥饿的难民聚集到拖拉机周围。

example.ex: Police blocked off the road as hotel staff and guests crowded around.
example.tran: 当酒店工作人员和旅客们都聚拢过来时，警察封锁了那条路。

entry.def: If people crowd into a place or are crowded into a place, large numbers of them enter it so that it becomes very full.

example.ex: Hundreds of thousands of people have crowded into the center of the Lithuanian capital, Vilnius...
example.tran: 几十万人涌入立陶宛首都维尔纽斯的市中心。

example.ex: One group of journalists were crowded into a minibus...
example.tran: 一群记者挤进一辆小型公共汽车。

entry.def: If a group of people crowd a place, there are so many of them there that it is full.

example.ex: Thousands of demonstrators crowded the streets shouting slogans.
example.tran: 数千名高喊着口号的示威者把街道挤得水泄不通。

entry.def: If people crowd you, they stand very closely around you trying to see or speak to you, so that you feel uncomfortable.

example.ex: It had been a tense, restless day with people crowding her all the time.
example.tran: 这是紧张、忙碌的一天，每时每刻都有人围在她身旁。
